alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford; Dubois; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Orange; Perry; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 31 at 3:51AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Heavy precipitation expected across the region on Wednesday and Thursday... A large scale weather system is expected to impact southern Indiana and central Kentucky in the mid-week period. Our area will be on the warm side of this system and locally heavy rainfall is expected. Given that our soils are fairly moist from recent snow melt, some flooding issues and eventual river flooding will be possible later this week. Rain is expected to develop across the region late Tuesday night and become more widespread during the day on Wednesday. A brief lull in the precipitation is possible Wednesday night before a second round of heavier precipitation moves into the region for Thursday. Colder air will arrive by Thursday evening changing this rain over to a mix of freezing rain, sleet, and some snow before the precipitation ends early Friday morning. Rainfall amounts of 2.5 to 3.5 inches are expected across the region with isolated higher amounts. Most areas however, will likely see around 3 inches or so. This amount of rainfall is expected to create excessive runoff which may result in localized flooding in some areas. Sharp rises on area creeks and streams are expected and some rivers across the region may go into flood by the end of the week and into the weekend. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest weather information.
